ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if postmaster has the correct mail alias.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Prevent Unrestricted Mail Relaying

mail is configured correctly

check if all server entries have maxpoll set in /etc/ntp.conf
check if no server or pool entry is set in /etc/chrony.conf
check if maxpoll is set in /etc/chrony.conf
check if all server entries have maxpoll set in /etc/chrony.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. group ownership of all files matches local rpm database

orasid in /etc/passwd has corresponding /sapmnt/SID/exe/brspace or /sapmnt/SID/exe/type/platform/brspace files

oracle user account in /etc/passwd is used for brsapce file

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using sudo

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure 'log_format' is configured with value 'ENRICHED' in /etc/audit/auditd.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Write Audit Logs to the Disk

ns0:criteria.comment: auditd is configured correctly

ns0:criterion.comment: Check the absence of write_logs in /etc/audit/auditd.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure SELinux Not Disabled in the kernel arguments
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure selinux=0 argument is not present in the 'options' line of /boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-*.conf (or ostree-1-*.conf if there is no ostree-2-*.conf as ostree has only two enries at the most, with *-2-*.conf entry always being the most recent). Also, ensure that kernel is currently running with this argument by checking /proc/cmdline.

ns0:criterion.comment: Pass if there are no files matching pattern '/boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-.*.conf' exist in the system
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /boot/loader/entries/ostree-1-.*.conf
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-.*.conf
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /proc/cmdline

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable User Administration in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure 'user-administration-disabled' is configured with value 'true in section 'org/gnome/desktop/lockdown' in /etc/dconf/db/local.d/

ns0:criteria.comment: dconf is configured correctly

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that System Executable Have Root Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /bin/, /sbin/, /usr/bin/, /usr/sbin/, /usr/local/bin/, /usr/local/sbin/ is owned by 0.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Directories Have Root Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /lib/, /lib64/, /usr/lib/, /usr/lib64/ is owned by 0.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that System Executable Directories Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /bin/, /sbin/, /usr/bin/, /usr/sbin/, /usr/local/bin/, /usr/local/sbin/ has mode 0755. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Directories Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /lib/, /lib64/, /usr/lib/, /usr/lib64/ has mode 7755. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

sshd is not installed

ns0:criteria.comment: sshd is installed and configured

the configuration is correct if it exists

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on shadow File
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg has mode 0600. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /lib/, /lib64/, /usr/lib/, /usr/lib64/ has mode 7755. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on SSH Server Public *.pub Key Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /etc/ssh/ has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /boot/grub2/user.cfg Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /boot/grub2/user.cfg has mode 0600. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on /var/log Directory
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /var/log/ has mode 0755. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on /var/log/messages File
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /var/log/messages has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on /var/log/syslog File
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This test makes sure that /var/log/syslog has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with Kerberos Security
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The sec_krb5_krb5i_krb5p option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with nodev
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev option should be enabled for all removable devices mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Mount Remote Filesystems with noexec
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The noexec option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The noexec option should be enabled for all removable devices mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure /boot Located On Separate Partition
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /boot. If /boot will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.
